newsitem.title: FINLAND: RAUMA SAYS TIMBERJACK TO CENTRALISE R&D.
newsitem.headline: RAUMA SAYS TIMBERJACK TO CENTRALISE R&D.

text.p: Finnish engineering group Rauma Oy said in a statement on Wednesday its Timberjack forestry harvester unit would concentrate its research and development operations in Tampere.
"The centralisation means that the unit's research and development department at its harvester plant in Filipstad, Sweden, will be transferred to Tampere," Rauma said.
It said its Filipstad marketing and client service operations would be transferred to a marketing centre to be established in Stockholm.
The transfer will affect 30 to 35 employees, Rauma said.
Timberjack has previously had its centre for development of cargo tractors in Tampere, it said.
